keyMoments.title: Zoro's Ultimate Sacrifice for His Captain
keyMoments.description: Zoro offers his life and absorbs all of Luffy's pain to save his captain, demonstrating the ultimate level of loyalty and the strength of the crew's bonds. Both Zoro and Sanji show they are willing to die for Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: This moment defines the Straw Hat Pirates as more than just a crew - they are a family willing to sacrifice everything for each other. It establishes the depth of loyalty that Luffy inspires in his crewmates.

keyMoments.title: Kuma Acknowledges the Crew's Strength
keyMoments.description: After witnessing Zoro's sacrifice, Bartholomew Kuma comments that 'Dragon has a good son,' acknowledging that Luffy has earned incredibly loyal crewmates who would give their lives for him.
keyMoments.significance: External validation from a powerful Warlord that the Straw Hat Pirates possess something rare and valuable - unbreakable bonds of loyalty and friendship.

jollyRoger.description: A skull wearing a straw hat with crossed bones behind it
